bodyParagraphs.text: Advanced Product Designer Business Value
Common pain points with designing product
In a time of rapid change in consumer demands, insurers are faced with a need to create and launch more new products in less time.
The following are common pain points observed while creating a new product or LOB:
Proof of concept takes too long
There is no product in the base configuration that satisfies the requirements
Jargon and confusing terminology
Lack of clarity around product design best practices
The collaboration between the business and technical teams is time consuming and expensive
To meet insurers needs and to address these common pain points, Guidewire has developed the Advanced Product Designer application.
Advanced Product Designer provides business value
The Advanced Product Designer (APD) provides business value in three important ways:
Empowering business:
By providing non-technical design tools which captures product requirements in a structural format.
Providing instant feedback:
By simulating the product within PolicyCenter, so that the customers can instantly observe what policy transactions would look like for their newly designed insurance product.
Simplifying IT processes:

The Advanced Product Designer automatically generates code for common artifacts, including the data model and user interface, thereby reducing product launch times and standardizing the configuration.

Benefits of externalizing Advanced Product Designer outside of PolicyCenter
By moving APD to a stand-alone, independent application on Guidewire Cloud there comes several benefits:

1.Improved Configuration and Design Experience - Manage all your insurance products in one place on Guidewire Cloud Home with a more business friendly User Interface and without requiring a PolicyCenter deployment.
2.Product Metadata APIs - users can create, update, and read product metadata via APIs
3.Product Editions and Variations - Ability to create jurisdiction-based product offerings and manage them independently (such as by state, country, or other locales, and effective date).
4.Improved lifecycle management -  Automated versioning and easy one-touch promotion across environments with no server restarts with a clear audit trail.
What is Advanced Product Designer
Advanced Product Designer is a business tool that helps insurers:
Gather business requirements to define and model an insurance product in a mind map, using the XMind tool
Simulate policy transactions for that insurance product in Guidewire PolicyCenter™
Auto-generate the insurance product artifacts for PolicyCenter such as:
Entity Model
Product Model
User interface components such as Page Configuration Files (PCFs)
Advanced Product Designer is used for creating new insurance products.
With Advanced Product Designer, you can:
Quickly build out insurance products and launch them using PolicyCenter.
Facilitate a business level discussion with all stakeholders early in the project.
Phases of Product Design with APD
The process of creating a new insurance product follows three phases when using the APD:
1.Conceptualization
2.Visualization
3.Finalization
Product design when using the APD
Click on the number to review the tasks for each phase of product design when using Advanced Product Designer.
Step 1
Conceptualization of the Product
Team members document the concepts and business requirements in a product map using the XMind tool.
The team shares the product map for review.
The map elements are annotated with Guidewire markers.
Step 2
Visualization of the Product
Import the annotated mind map to APD.
Make enhancements to the visualized product by adding rules, conditions, and default-minimum-maximum values.
Simulate policy transactions to visualize how the policy will work, thus eliminating the need to manually build a prototype.
Review, share, and further enhance the saved visualization templates.
Step 3
Finalization of the Product
Add metadata to generate the product code.

Generate product from the visualized product.
The product generation process creates the artifacts needed for PolicyCenter including:
Entity Model
Product Model
User Interface components

Advanced Product Designer versus Product Designer
Advanced Product Designer is not just a product modeling tool.
Using Advanced Product Designer you can:
Define and model a new insurance product, including coverages, exclusions, conditions, risk details, and other attributes
Define product model properties
Availability of clauses (coverages, conditions, and exclusions) and fields
Default, minimum, and maximum values
Conditional existence of clauses (required, suggested, electable) and fields
Auto-generate insurance product artifacts for PolicyCenter
Entity model: All required entities and their attributes, typelists
Product model: Product, Policy Line, Clauses, Clause terms
Full set of Page Configuration Files (PCFs) to support all policy transactions
After you generate a new product using Advanced Product Designer, that product then displays in Product Designer.
You can then further implement that product in Product Designer, using the following Product Designer capabilities:
Defining offerings
Question sets
Modifiers
